titles: The defence of conny catching. Or A confutation of those two iniurious pamphlets published by R.G. against the practitioners of many nimble-witted and mysticall sciences. By Cuthbert Cunny-catcher, licentiate in Whittington Colledge.
author: Greene, Robert, 1558?-1592.
publisher: By A. I[effes] for Thomas Gubbins and are to be sold by Iohn Busbie,
notes: "Although this is nominally a riposte to [Robert] Greene's "A notable discovery of coosenage" and "The second part of conny-catching" (S65), it reads more like an advertisement for those two pieces, and is almost certainly from the same pen"--Halkett & Laing (3d ed.).
Quire A is partly reimposed from STC 5654.5.
Reproductions of the originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery (reel 526) and the British Library (reel 1443).
keywords: Greene, Robert, 1558?-1592. --  Notable discovery of coosenage.
Greene, Robert, 1558?-1592. --  Second part of conny-catching.
